With Vampyr, Danish filmmaker Carl Theodor DreyerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s brilliance at achieving mesmerizing atmosphere and austere, profoundly unsettling imagery (The Passion of Joan of Arc and Day of Wrath) was for once applied to the horror genre. Yet the resultÃ¢â‚¬â€concerning an occult student assailed by various supernatural haunts and local evildoers in a village outside ParisÃ¢â‚¬â€is nearly unclassifiable, a host of stunning camera and editing tricks and densely layered sounds creating a mood of dreamlike terror. With its roiling fogs, ominous scythes, and foreboding echoes, Vampyr is one of cinemaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s great nightmares.
